snippet: Repsol YPF said that it would seek at least $10.5 billion in compensation for Argentina’s planned nationalization of its extensive operations there.
abstract: Repsol YPF says it will seek at least $10.5 billion in compensation for Argentina's planned nationalization of its extensive operations there; Pres Christina Fernandez de Kirchner's plan calls for the Argentine government to take a 51 percent controlling stake in the company; Repsol is counting on strong political support in an affair that has harmed Argentina's relationship with Spain.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and SIMON ROMERO
byline.contributor: Raphael Minder reported from Madrid, and Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro. David Barboza contributed from Shanghai, and Paul Geitner from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: Repsol YPF said that it would seek at least $10.5 billion in compensation for Argentina’s planned nationalization of its extensive operations there.

headline.seo: Spain Weighs Response to Nationalization of YPF
headline.main: Spain Weighs Response to Nationalization of YPF
headline.print_headline: Spain Weighs a Response to Argentina’s Move on YPF
